channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Did Starmer Impose a Curfew in the U.K.? No, It’s a Fake TikTok Video.
item.description: A.I. has made it easy to put words in people’s mouths, and Prime Minister Keir Starmer of Britain has become a favorite target. The motive, experts sa...

item.title: The ‘Trump Effect’ on Global Elections
item.description: President Trump has become a common theme in races around the world. Our Canada bureau chief, Matina Stevis-Gridneff, gives a rundown of some of the r...

item.title: The Cover-Up: Inside the Plot to Conceal Assad’s Crimes
item.description: Thousands of documents and interviews with Assad-era officials reveal how the regime worked to conceal evidence of its atrocities during the Syrian ci...

item.title: Katherine Maher of NPR Has Come Out on Top Despite Battles With Trump and the CPB
item.description: Katherine Maher has taken an unyielding approach to NPR’s biggest battles — which has sometimes put her at odds with her colleagues in public media.

item.title: Can a Corporation Be Complicit in War Crimes? Sweden Is Trying to Find Out.
item.description: It’s Sweden’s longest criminal trial. I was there because of a different historic distinction.

item.title: Saudis Say Airstrike in Yemen Targeted Arms From U.A.E.
item.description: The Saudi-led coalition said its strike, at a port in southern Yemen, targeted weapons bound for a separatist group backed by the United Arab Emirates...

item.title: How the Assad Regime Covered Up Its Crimes: Key Takeaways
item.description: We documented how the dictator Bashar al-Assad and his henchmen conspired to hide evidence of torture and deaths of detainees during Syria’s long civi...

item.title: K-Pop Group NewJeans Faces New Uncertainty After Member Is Dropped
item.description: The band’s label said it had dropped one of the girl group’s five members. NewJeans’s legal battle has drawn public scrutiny of the K-pop industry.
